questions.question_text: What configuration step is required for booting the Session Border Controller from an external FTP server?

choices.B: Navigate to the system configuration branch and set the ip address field of the wancom1 management interface.
choices.A: Navigate to the bootparams configuration branch and set the host inet field to the IP address of the external BOOTP Server from which the Session Border Controller can boot.
choices.C: Navigate to the bootparams configuration branch and set the ip address field of the destination SIP device with which the Session Border Controller needs to interact.
choices.D: Navigate to the system configuration branch and set the ip address field of the wancom0 management interface.
choices.E: Navigate to the bootparams configuration branch, set the host inet or Host IP, FTP username, and FTP password for the external FTP Server in

choices.D: Navigate to the sip-port configuration element and set the allow-anonymous parameter to agents-only.
choices.B: Navigate to the session-agent configuration element and set the ip-address parameter to the IP subnet of your trusted User Agent (UA).
choices.C: Navigate to the realm-config configuration element and set the addr-prefix parameter to the IP subnet of your trusted User Agent (UA).
choices.A: Navigate to the sip-port configuration element and set the allow-anonymous parameter to all.
choices.E: Navigate to the sip-port configuration element and set the allow-anonymous parameter to address-prefix.

discussion.content: C and D should be correct. You can only define the complete IP address is SA Ip-address field.Using addr-prefix parameter in realm we can limit communication from the ip subnet range.

These are all wrong. B, C
B: (realm-config)# addr
addr-prefix address prefix to match realm

C: (sip-port)# allow-anonymous
<enumeration> allowed requests from SIP realm
all allow all anonymous connections
agents-only only requests from session agents allowed
realm-prefix session agents and address matching realm prefix
registered session agents and registered endpoints (REGISTER allowed from any endpoint)
register-prefix session agents and registered endpoints (REGISTER only from session agents and endpoint address matching realm prefix)

comments.content: Screwed up the letters on this. C, D (the comments and proof are correct, just mixed up the letters since I couldn't see the screen behind comment box)
false, B D is the right answer

discussion.content:
E is incorrect> allow-anonymous parameter don't have "address-prefix." options. 
 allow-anonymous parameter options are: realm-prefix/agents-only/all/ registered/ register-prefix

Answer should be : B,D

questions.question_text:
You are configuring access rules in a Session Border Controller Peering architecture.
Which two configuration steps are required to allow access only from User Agents (UAs) configured as session agents? (Choose two.)
When setting up the registration-caching parameter to enabled in the sip-interface configuration element, _____________.

choices.D: only endpoints behind NAT in the realm will be cached when registered
choices.A: the Session Border Controller will never use the SIP-NAT mechanism for routing
choices.B: the Session Border Controller will not use the registration cache for routing
choices.E: the Session Border Controller will never use the local-policy mechanism for routing
choices.C: all endpoints in the realm will be cached when registered

discussion.content: D, registration caching habilita y deshablita el registro de UAs detras del NAT

questions.question_text: What is the effect of executing the save-config command in superuser mode?

choices.B: The running configuration version does not increase and is equal to the saved configuration version.
choices.A: The running configuration version is reset to 1.
choices.E: The editing configuration version increases by 1 and is higher than the saved configuration version.
choices.C: The saved configuration version increases by 1 and is higher than the running configuration version.
choices.D: The running configuration version increases by 1 and is higher than the saved configuration version.
Navigate to the phy-interface configuration element and configure the pri-utility-address parameter.
choices.E: Navigate to the network-interface configuration element and configure the name parameter.
choices.B: Navigate to the network-interface configuration element and set the sub-port-id parameter to 0.
choices.C: Navigate to the phy-interface configuration element and configure the hip-id parameter.
choices.A: Navigate to the network-interface configuration element and set the sub-port-id parameter to 12.

questions.question_text:
You are configuring a network interface to enable the Session Border Controller to use the interface for signaling and media.
Identify two valid configuration steps for supporting VLAN 12 (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
A,E
C is not correct, there is no "hip-id parameter " in phy-int
